body_html:
Which speed are you seeing? I've tested on p3.16 instance which has 64 cores, maybe that's a factor?

Using Pytorch 0.3.0.post4

How to reproduce:
Allocate p3.16xlarge on AWS with Deep Learning AMI (I used v3.0 ubuntu conda version), ssh into it, then

source activate pytorch_p36
pip install -U torch
pip install tf-nightly-gpu
pip install -U https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/ray-wheels/73be23570145fbabe01ea7c83262860c21c35f06/ray-0.3.1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
pip install portpicker

wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/diux-dev/cluster/master/yuxin_numpy/tf_numpy_benchmark.py
python tf_numpy_benchmark.py --benchmark=pytorch_add --allocator=pytorch --num-iters=11 --size-mb=1024
python tf_numpy_benchmark.py --benchmark=pytorch_add --allocator=tf --num-iters=11 --size-mb=1024

body:
Which speed are you seeing? I've tested on p3.16 instance which has 64 cores, maybe that's a factor? 

Using Pytorch 0.3.0.post4

How to reproduce:
Allocate p3.16xlarge  on AWS with Deep Learning AMI (I used v3.0 ubuntu conda version), ssh into it, then

```
source activate pytorch_p36
pip install -U torch
pip install tf-nightly-gpu
pip install -U https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/ray-wheels/73be23570145fbabe01ea7c83262860c21c35f06/ray-0.3.1-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
pip install portpicker

wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/diux-dev/cluster/master/yuxin_numpy/tf_numpy_benchmark.py
python tf_numpy_benchmark.py --benchmark=pytorch_add --allocator=pytorch --num-iters=11 --size-mb=1024
python tf_numpy_benchmark.py --benchmark=pytorch_add --allocator=tf --num-iters=11 --size-mb=1024
```
